title: WCAS KOREAN 125-2-20 Korean II - Accelerated

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This is a two-quarter-long second-year Accelerated Korean course designed for Korean heritage students with basic oral proficiency and literacy skills. The objectives of this class are to reinforce the aspects that heritage students are usually weak - - vocabulary, common grammatical and spelling errors - - and to enhance their reading and writing skills so that they could develop a more balanced proficiency in four language areas. It also aims to have students achieve the competency in the skills of Communication, Comparisonsand Cultures in conjunction with the National Standards.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Completion of 125-1 or a departmental placement test for Winter Quarter

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: This class is conducted exclusively in Korean with minimal grammar instruction. It provides with various activities such as watching a Korean film or drama. Students will be doing extensive writing practice, reading authentic materials, watching videos, and learning various cultural aspects of Korea.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Grades will be given based on attendance and performance, vocabulary quizzes and lesson tests, assignments, written assignments, oral presentations, and final examination.
